body_html: I've been averaging 1-3 unrelated failing tests for my PR submissions. Back when I was on TensorFlow team I tried to make sure that all tests were 100% passing all the time but it was hard. You can make internal changes blocking on all tests passing only if tests are super-fast. But the tests are only super-fast if people take extra care to make their tests efficient/parallelized. So eventually end-to-end testing time gets slow and by the time failure is noticed, the person who broke them went to lunch/home/etc
